New Records: Rohit and Rinku stitched together an unbeaten partnership of 190 runs against Afghanistan, the highest T20I partnership for any wicket for India.
Rohit Sharma's 121* is the highest score for the captain in the shortest format for India, but the fourth-highest individual score for India in T20Is.
India posted the highest total for a team after being four down for 25 or less, reaching 212/4.
The duo of Rinku Singh and Rohit Sharma helped India score 36 runs in the final over of the match, courtesy of a no-ball, the most runs scored in an over in T20Is.
Rohit Sharma and Rinku Singh's unbeaten partnership of 190 runs is the highest for any side at 5th wicket or below in T20Is.
Key Match Events: Rohit and Rinku remained unbeaten till the end of the innings, guiding the team to a total of 212 runs, capping off the innings by scoring 36 runs in the final over.
Rohit slammed 121 runs off 69 balls with 11 fours and eight sixes while on the other hand, Rinku played an unbeaten knock of 69 runs from 39 balls with two fours and six sixes in his innings.
Post-Match Reflections: With this series win, India now have 9 whitewash series wins in T20I cricket - the most by any country in the shortest format of the sport.
Rohit now holds the record for scoring the most runs as an Indian captain in T20Is, going past Virat Kohli's tally of 1570 runs in 50 T20Is.
Rohit is now the second captain after Babar Azam to hit three T20I centuries as the captain of the team.
The Hitman sits top of the list when it comes to the number of bilateral T20I series wins for India as captain, with 12 to his name.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The third T20I for India helped Rohit equal MS Dhoni's record of winning 42 T20Is for India.
The match required two Super Overs to conclude the result, the first-ever double Super Over in an international match.
